intro: Beccariella sebertii, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant wood that is highly valued in traditional medicine and perfumery. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange-red fruits containing winged seeds. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. Beccariella sebertii is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
